title: Stop making it pretty
text: and fix the random logouts. always seems to be logged out right when i need it in a hurry.

title: Great product
text: I‚Äôve had scout for 3 years in a 2800sq foot, 2 story house. I‚Äôve had zero issues with the app and the product. You change out batteries once every 12-18 months. I‚Äôve only had 1 false alarm from a dying battery that I knew about. The app is easy to use and looks great to the user. Not sure why anyone else gives it a negative review.

title: What happened to integration?
text: Where did the option to control nest cams go with the last update? It was nice being able to use one app instead of two. They show connected through the nest app, but not this one - nor can you add them back. Thinking of ditching the system for the new Ring system that‚Äôs out - which is also half the price monthly.

title: Easy setup and installation
text: Super easy to install and this app works great. I like knowing if I armed the system by just checking the app. The modes are great too for customizing alert notifications.

title: Great concept but not ready for primetrime
text: Just not ready for primetime. The sound from the hub is very low hardly audible. Seems they missed out on the design. The sensors are just too big. Service and support is great but software has limitations and hardware has a long way to go. Cellular service never shows of working and so far tough to say if even get a signal. I would like to give it 5 stars but can't till they upgrade or redesign hardware so sound is audible. Also the app starts showing cellular signal. Please please make it more audible and please provide iPhone 6 plus compatible app. Also please provide option to turn on chirp if door open or close using a sensor. Also fix bug with cellular signal showing in app. Will update rating if fixed.

title: App is unreliable
text:
This happens regularly. I come home and disarm the alarm. Open the door and the alarm goes off. Have to reboot my phone. By then I am getting a call. Or a police officer is in my driveway. 

Happened again today. Try another product!

title: Random logouts make it not worth getting
text: It‚Äôs infuriating trying to disarm your system only to find the app randomly logged you out. Makes me reconsider getting this system altogether.

title: Terrible product
text: Not worth the money. Can get better service from other providers. The app isn‚Äôt great-constantly signed you out. Look elsewhere for real security.

title: New version crashes (updated)
text:
Newest version keeps having popup that says upgrade is available (even though one isn't because I just upgraded to the newest version) then immediately crashes and will not open unless I delete and redownload then ignore the popup. Please come out with a patch to fix this bug. Otherwise the app is great when it worked before this update. 5 stars then but a patch is certainly needed. 

Updated review: I see that with the new update you can now update the app without having to formally download it through the App Store. The issue seems to have been resolved as of now but hopefully I will not have the crashing issue in the future with the forced updates anymore. Overall the security system I love and the app is very intricate and streamlined in appearance. I have already recommended it to many friends.

title: Scout Alarm Fan
text: The Scout Alarm app is beautifully designed.  A lot of thought went into the iOS app to make it integrate so well with the scout alarm system.  Even though the scout alarm system was dreamed and built via crowd funding and a team of 6, they have certainly delivered.  Any issue I have is promptly addressed and fixed by their support staff.  New feature requests are considered and built if determined to be necessary to the customer base.  I really like my scout alarm system and I am happy I have backed them for almost a year now waiting for the system.  The iOS app works great with the system and I would recommend the system to anyone wanting an alarm system they can install themselves, feel secure, and not have to hire a professional to fish wires all over your house.  Thanks Scout Alarm and keep up the good work!

title: App syncing to sensors needs work
text: The Scout system is solid when everything is online and synced to the app. The syncing fails every so often causing everything to need to be reset. The mobile app performance could be more stable. Overall, the alarm works well and is a good mobile options- just be ready to work through the kinks.

title: Great smart home alarm
text:
This is a good alarm choice for a smart home - and one that doesn‚Äôt break the bank. We have our Scout integrated with Alexa and IFTT. This is ultra convenient for voice arming and disarming, as well as auto arming on a schedule.

The app is pretty good and gives the notifications I need. And allows good control.

I see this alarm as a deterrent to a burglar. And a warning to me as owner. Not a full-proof one. Though I think few are full-proof.

Sometimes there is a delay on sensors responding-due mostly to the location of the hub-so plan ahead on that. And I‚Äôve also had sensor need to be reset to work at all. ...So on these points is where it gets 4 stars instead of 5. Ideally it would be perfectly reliable. But it‚Äôs pretty darn good. And if you are willing to monitor it a little the little things are workable.

I didn‚Äôt find a better solution for what I was willing to spend and for the convenience this has. 

I‚Äôd recommend this system for a fairly low risk middle income neighborhood like mine, where I‚Äôm a pro-active owner.

title: I like it.
text:
This system works pretty well, customer support is responsive if you need help and it is easy to install. 
I can easily set the alarm on the way out, or if I space out I can can do it from my phone. This is a plus. 
And, you see a updated record of your door opening and closing, alarms set and canceled. Pretty handy if you have a dog walker or someone else coming by. 
The new system is plenty loud for me, I have it set in the lowest ‚Äúchirp‚Äù. 
All in all, it does what I was looking for without breaking the bank.

title: Not ready for prime time
text: Not by a long shot.  You need to go to their site and read the community forum reviews before wasting money on this system.  The alarm "sounder" wouldn't wake a sleeping child, there's no way (other than turning on your phone, unlocking, launching the app) to tell if the system is armed or disarmed. There's no "immediate trip" in home mode, you can't add anything other than their hardware - their ZigBee choice (ZigBee with a proprietary stack) doesn't support any 3rd part hardware (unlike the zillions of zwave devices - what were they thinking) and if you lose cloud connectivity you lose your alarm system plain and simple.  The only positive is their design and packaging is gorgeous - as an alarm system this is useless. Oh, and the app is buggy.  Stay away.

title: Great DIY Security
text: All the components work well and the app is easy to use. I like being able to arm/disarm and see activity while I am away. Some features I would like to see added is the ability to see when motion is detected in the activity log even when the system is not armed. I would also like to keep seeing activity be recorded while an alarm is going off so I know if there is really a problem. It would also be a good idea to have a panic button in the app to be able to set the alarm off manually if you needed to.

title: iPhone addict convenient!
text: I got the alarm system, keeping in mind that it would come with an app. I tend to use my phone for everything so this just made sense. I'm addicted to my iPhone so it made using my Scout alarm much easier than what I've had for security in the past. It made it really easy to let in my cleaning lady. I like how I can monitor the activity via the app when I'm away. Also, love being able to arm and disarm it from the phone.

title: Latest version worse than before
text:
The newest version, though with the same features, is really just a downgrade. Had these glitches been there when we first purchased the alarm, I would have returned it that week. Here are some: 

- screen does not refresh. If you arm/disarm the system, you now have to leave the page and come back (if not restart the app) to see whether the system is armed or not
- logs do not update in real time any more (similar to first quirk)...this makes it incredibly difficult to troubleshoot a sensor. You have to fully quit the app and restart it to get the updated logs.
- sounds are still horrible as you can't set phone up to actually wake you up in the event of an intruder
- app allows little to no customization of how you want the alarm to function

Bottom line, if you just bought a Scout, I recommend returning it and looking elsewhere.

title: Keep being logged out
text:
This app constantly just logs me out.  What is the point of this when I have to race to login so I can disarm my system before the time runs out.  This is the only app on my phone that does this to me. Also no development on anything from this company in years.  Recent "update" was same system with a minor meaningless enhancement.

I don't know what the people at Scout actually do all day. Everything they promise is delayed (even the release of their newsletter!) and no actual new hardware devices. Just minor meaningless update to existing sensor models.

title: Cool App and Alarm System
text: Has worked very well since purchasing and installing. Only bug I've noticed is when you hit the "Subscriptions" option in the More section of the app. It locks up the app. This is recoverable on the iPhone 6 but the app has to be uninstalled and reinstalled again in order to not have a perpetual crash upon start on the iPhone 5s.

title: Unreliable
text:
One sensor arrived DOA, another fell off of a window not 30 hours after being installed. The system does not notify you if a window or door is open when setting the alarm and if you close it after the alarm is set, it triggers an alarm. The actual alarm is incredibly quiet. There is no notification that an access point was opened if not using a door panel.

Support is nice but if I can't trust the system for 48 hours, what's the point?

Keep your family safe, move onto another product!

title: Is Scout Still Breathing?
text:
Scout alarm to me is just another tech start-up that's full of promises and only lives up to a portion of what they advertise. The system is nothing to write home about. The devices themselves are not too bad, however; the app is weak. The latest few updates nag you to upgrade or update... After months of owning the system I'm still plagued by ridiculous battery life issues. Windows that never open... Battery is dead, huh???

I'll add this one to the waste column and look to Abode security.

title: Crashing after update...
text: Same problem as others. App will not open. Waiting for fix. Minor complaint about the app UI not doing the elegance of the system any justice. Could use a cosmetic lift. As far as the crashing app, while waiting for the fix, the widget can still be used to arm/disarm even though the app itself cannot be accessed.

title: Great alarm / horrid UI
text: Scout is a great system and I'm generally happy with it. My two complaints are (1) the motion sensors are to sensitive, my pug sets it off (2) the UI is complex, unintuitive and cumbersome to use. They have limited integration with third party apps (hue, nest, etc) but they are improving constantly.

title: User Friendly Security
text: Just received and installed my new Scout system. Very intuitive and user friendly. The App runs very smoothly and I got my system up and running much faster than I had anticipated.

title: Not reliable
text: If you are looking for a security system to protect your property or loved ones look elsewhere.  The mesh network is finicky and battery life is dismal.  Alarms and notifications lag behind by seconds which says something about whether or not it will perform when you need it to.  This is based on a 3000square foot home.  It might work better with smaller homes or apartments.  Save ur money and get something reliable - i will be.

title: Needs improvement all around

Also when are we supposed to get the updated firmware so we don't have to replace batteries every 2-4 months?

title: Scout
text:
Has problems with app software.
Widgets do not perform well.
Icons are suppose to show in widget to indicate the state of each. 
When arming/ disarming your suppose to receive an audible tone on phone, indicating that has taking place.
Also, the widget showing activities ( access sensors etc. ) only shows blank lines with no information being stated.
Please note: widgets are not the app page itself, widgets appear when you swipe down from top of your phone screen.
After contacting support was told they were aware of problem and a new app was released to correct problem.
That was on 6-9-017 and I downloaded that update. Problems still exist even after uninstalling and reinstalling app on two separate occasions.
This is my second Scout system as the first had many problems with performance and poor battery life.
The new, and greatly improved system is working just fine with the exception of the app function as mentioned.
My wife has the same app on her Android phone and receives a audible tone on a arm/disarm .
Although I,m still working with Scout on problem with MY phone , which is an I Phone, it has as of 6-12-017 not been resolved.
